item.title: New FrigidStealer infostealer infects Macs via fake browser updates
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: The FakeUpdate malware campaigns are increasingly becoming muddled, with two additional cybercrime groups tracked as TA2726 and TA2727, running campaigns that push a new macOS infostealer malware called FrigidStealer. [...]

item.title: Australian fertility services giant Genea hit by security breach
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: ​Genea, one of Australia's largest fertility services providers, disclosed that unknown attackers breached its network and accessed data stored on compromised systems. [...]

item.title: Palo Alto Networks tags new firewall bug as exploited in attacks
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Palo Alto Networks warns that hackers are actively exploiting a critical authentication bypass flaw (CVE-2025-0108) in PAN-OS firewalls, chaining it with two other vulnerabilities to breach devices in active attacks. [...]

item.title: The Browser Blind Spot: Why Your Browser is the Next Cybersecurity Battleground
item.dc:creator: Sponsored by Keep Aware
item.description: For years, defensive security strategies have focused on three core areas: network, endpoint, and email. Meanwhile, the browser, sits across all of them. This article examines three key areas where attackers focus their efforts and how browser-based attacks are evolving. [...]

item.title: Russian phishing campaigns exploit Signal's device-linking feature
item.dc:creator: Ionut Ilascu
item.description: Russian threat actors have been launching phishing campaigns that exploit the legitimate "Linked Devices" feature in the Signal messaging app to gain unauthorized access to accounts of interest. [...]

item.title: New WinRAR version strips Windows metadata to increase privacy
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: WinRAR 7.10 was released yesterday with numerous features, such as larger memory pages, a dark mode, and the ability to fine-tune how Windows Mark-of-the-Web flags are propagated when extracting files. [...]

item.title: Cracked Garry’s Mod, BeamNG.drive games infect gamers with miners
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: A large-scale malware campaign dubbed "StaryDobry" has been targeting gamers worldwide with trojanized versions of cracked games such as Garry's Mod, BeamNG.drive, and Dyson Sphere Program. [...]

item.title: Venture capital giant Insight Partners hit by cyberattack
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: New York-based venture capital and private equity firm Insight Partners has disclosed that its systems were breached in January following a social engineering attack. [...]

item.title: Microsoft reminds admins to prepare for WSUS driver sync deprecation
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Microsoft once again reminded IT administrators that driver synchronization in Windows Server Update Services (WSUS) will be deprecated on April 18, just 60 days from now. [...]

item.title: Chinese hackers abuse Microsoft APP-v tool to evade antivirus
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: The Chinese APT hacking group "Mustang Panda" has been spotted abusing the Microsoft Application Virtualization Injector utility as a LOLBIN to inject malicious payloads into legitimate processes to evade detection by antivirus software. [...]

item.title: New OpenSSH flaws expose SSH servers to MiTM and DoS attacks
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: OpenSSH has released security updates addressing two vulnerabilities, a man-in-the-middle (MitM) and a denial of service flaw, with one of the flaws introduced over a decade ago. [...]

item.title: Juniper patches critical auth bypass in Session Smart routers
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: ​Juniper Networks has patched a critical vulnerability that allows attackers to bypass authentication and take over Session Smart Router (SSR) devices. [...]

item.title: Compliance Isn’t Security: Why a Checklist Won’t Stop Cyberattacks
item.dc:creator: Sponsored by Pentera
item.description: Think you're safe because you're compliant? Think again. Recent studies continue to highlight the concerning trend that compliance with major security frameworks does not necessarily prevent data breaches. Learn more from Pentera on how automated security validation bridges the security gaps. [...]
